fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Linear Independence of Characters
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Dummit and Foote Abstract Algebra Theorem 14.2.7

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: If \chi _{1}, …, \chi _{n} are distinct characters of G with values in \mathbb {F}, then they are linearly independent over \mathbb {F}.
(Proof by contradiction) Assume \chi _{1}, …, \chi _{n} are linearly dependent. By removing some \chi _{i}, we can assume any proper subset of \{\chi _{1},…,\chi _{n}\} is independent.
